values:
Ok, after the hospital visit which turned up no heart issues, I went back to doc.  Got Advair, turns out the chest xray showed COPD, early stages. 
So, go BACK after another week of painfilled sleepless nights.
Doc gave me Prevacid and scheduled me for a HIDA scan, they inject dye, and track it thru the gall bladder and all the bile ducts.  On a very happy note, the back pain has been manageable and liveable since the prevacid.  At times it's nonexistent.  I start getting sore again about 10 hours before the next pill (one a day).  I do have a call in, to ask if I can take 2 a day cuz they don't keep me pain free for 24 hours.
The pain that I get, though, is NOTHING compared to what it was.  So, if doc says no, to twice a day, I'm ok with it.
So, I'll letcha know what happens tomorrow.

Went to my clinic Monday.  Told the doc there that I hadn't ben given ANY test results, just told that my heart and gall bladder were fine, given a scrip for Darvocet and Famotodine (expensive Pepcid), and sent home.
She had a fit.  It's a good thing I asked about test results too, because they found COPD on my chest xrays.  We discussed family, and my, med history and came to the conclusion that it is emphysema.  I've never had any asthma issues, my bronchitis is not chronic (only flares up when I get a cold), and emphysema is what killed my dad.  She, the doc, told me that this is why when I get a cold the cough will hang on for weeks and will be as severe as it is.  
So, now I'm on Advair.  Still waking up in the morning with the chest/back pain that sent me to the hospital in the first place.  But I know that it's not heart related.  I think my gall bladder is messed up, there's one more test that they're gonna do if I keep having pain, but they don't do it as a standard test because it involves injecting a dye into the hollow organs.  But, I think it's the only thing that's gonna show what's going on.  I've also had some other symptoms that I won't go into here.  
Got a call in to my doc... We'll see what she has to say today.

Went back to doc on Friday.  Saw a woman, because of my mom's heart history and the fact that women experience heart issues differently, she didn't assume it was a pulled muscle.  Sent me to the hospital for complete testing.  Stress tests, Upper GI, chest x-rays, the whole 9 yards.
Came back negative.  Just one helluva a pulled muscle I guess.  I have NO problem admitting that the chest pain Friday morning scared the fuck out of me AND hubby.  Finally got home last nite about 9 pm.  
I'm going for follow up tomorrow.  Don't know what we're gonna do now.  I'll keep you posted.

Pulled a muscle in my back, and can't sit, stand, or lie down for more than an hour or so at a time.  Got some stuff from doc yesterday, hopefully it'll work.  It helped a little last nite.. I actually got to sleep 3 hours before I woke up in pain.  
I HAVE found that my couch is the best place for me after I wake up the first time.  I have GOT to get this fixed.

Got my machine back up and running!  Not a lot of time to write right now got to get the kids ready for bed.  Been busy working at their school.  Better update later, I'm still looking for bookmarks, etc....  lost when comp. died.

Mooch isn't the word, WHORE is.  That's what it is, you sell yourself for "gifts" and "loans", then brag about it, and slam and disrespect people who have helped your fat lying ass.  That is what whores do, they use people, sell themselves and then pretend it's all ok.

A question from a computer dummy...
My cd-rom has quit.  It tries to read, the light comes on, etc.
But the puter acts like there's no cd-rom there.
Any help is appreciated.  I'm desperate, I have a 4 yr old that is going to have to be killed if we don't get blue's clues running soon.
My back, upper this time, right between the shoulder blades.  Can't bend my head forward very far.  Been to the chiropractor, going back Monday.  I'm in major pain.

YIPPEEE!!!


Except my baby's gonna be gone!

1. Men are like Slinkies . . . not really good for anything, but you still can't help but smile when you see one tumble down the stairs.
 
2. I read recipes the same way I read science fiction. I get to the end and think, "Well, that's not going to happen".
 
 3. Health nuts are going to feel stupid someday, lying in hospitals dying of nothing.
 
 4. The other night I ate at a really nice family restaurant. Every table had an argument going.
 
 5. Have you noticed since everyone has a camcorder in the car these days no one talks about seeing UFO's like they used to?
 
 6. You know when you're sitting on a chair and you lean back so  you're just on two legs then you lean too far and you almost fall over but at the last second you catch yourself? I feel like that all the time.
 
7. According to a recent survey, men say that the first thing they notice about a woman are their eyes. And women say that the first thing they notice about men is that they're a bunch of liars.
 
 8. Whenever I feel blue, I start breathing again.
 
 9. All of us could take a lesson from the weather. It pays no attention to criticism.
 
 10. Why does a slight tax increase cost you two hundred dollars and a substantial tax cut save you thirty cents?
 
 11. I'm not 40-something. I'm $39.95, plus shipping and handling.
 
 12. In the 60's people took acid to make the world weird. Now the world IS weird and people take Prozac to make it seem normal.
 
 13. Politics is supposed to be the second oldest profession. I have come to realize that it bears a very close resemblance to the first.
 
 14. There is a theory which states that if ever anybody discovers exactly what the Universe is for and why it is here, it will instantly disappear and be replaced by something even more bizarre and inexplicable. There is another theory which states that this has already happened.
 
 15. How is it that one careless match can start a forest fire, but it takes a whole box to start a campfire?
 
 16. Doctors can be frustrating. You wait a month-and-a-half for an appointment, and he says, "I wish you'd have come to me sooner."
 
 17. You read about all these terrorists -- most of them came here legally, but they hung around on these expired visas, some for as long as 10-15 years. Now, compare that to Blockbuster; you are two days late with a video and those people are all over you. Let's put Blockbuster in charge of immigration.

Joys of Womanhood - Brilliant Woman Author Unknown
****************************************************************

Women over 50 don't have babies because they would put them down and forget where they left them.

One of life's mysteries is how a 2 pound box of candy can make a woman gain 5 lbs.

My mind not only wanders, it sometime leaves completely.

The best way to forget all your troubles is to wear tight shoes.

The nice part about living in a small town is that when you don't know what you're doing, someone else does.

The older you get, the tougher it is to lose weight because by then, your body and your fat are really good friends.

Just when I was getting used to yesterday, along came today.

Sometimes I think I understand everything, then I regain consciousness.

I gave up jogging for my health when my thighs kept rubbing together and setting my pantyhose on fire.

Amazing! You hang something in your closet for awhile and it shrinks two sizes!

Skinny people irritate me! Especially when they say things like, "You know,sometimes I just forget to eat." 
Now I've forgotten my address, my mother's maiden name, and my keys. 
But I've never forgotten to eat. You have to be a special kind of stupid to forget to eat.

A friend of mine confused her valium with her birth control pills. She had 14 kids, but she doesn't really care.

The trouble with some women is that they get all excited about nothing and then they marry him.

I read this article that said the typical symptoms of stress are: 
eating too much, impulse buying, and driving too fast. Are they kidding? That is my idea of a perfect day.

I know what Victoria's Secret is. The secret is that nobody older than 30 can fit into their stuff.

Celebrate Womanhood! Please forward this page to all the brilliant women in your life!

Guess Omar's done, or just about.  
I thought it was just a hick, appalachain thing to be over 18 and still call your mother "Mommy".....  Guess not, they do it in PA as well.

My daughter's school had it's Summer Festival, this weekend.  I worked from 6-10pm Friday night, then we all went so the kids could play games and have some fun on Saturday.  Then today I was scheduled to work from 12:30-1:30, Marti asked if she could go along.  Well, we both ended up working from 12-4:30.  Some people didn't show and we were having so much fun.  
The chairman conned me into getting in the dunking booth.  Marti couldn't hit the target with the ball so the little shit snuck around behind me and pulled the lever by hand...  THREE times!  LOL  We had so much fun!

Yesterday.  Marti wanted to plant something.  So, we went to Lowe's and there it was, the prettiest little rose bush with three buds.  Best part.....  It was $3,  some of the leaves were turning yellow and they had it marked down for clearance.  I snagged it.  
Got it home and planted it.  Marti has worried over it and watered it and threatened the dogs, cat and her sister with serious bodily damage when they get within 6 feet of it.  LOL  Pulled off the yellow leaves and gave it some plant food, it's doing very well.  There should be blooms tomorrow or the next day.  I just hope the girls can leave them on the plant and don't bring them in.

You know you're addicted to coffee when .. 
 
You grind your coffee beans in your mouth.

You sleep with your eyes open.

You have to watch videos in fast-forward.

The only time you're standing still is during an earthquake.

You can take a picture of yourself from ten feet away without using the timer.

You've worn out your third pair of tennis shoes this week.

Your eyes stay open when you sneeze.

You chew on other people's fingernails.

The nurse needs a scientific calculator to take your pulse.

You're so jittery that people use your hands to blend their margaritas.

You can type sixty words per minute with your feet.

You can jump-start your car without cables.

You don't sweat, you percolate.

You walk twenty miles on your treadmill before you realize it's not plugged in.

You forget to unwrap candy bars before eating them.

You've built a miniature city out of little plastic stirrers.

People get dizzy just watching you.

Instant coffee takes too long.

You channel surf faster without a remote.

You have a picture of your coffee mug on your coffee mug.

You can outlast the Energizer bunny.

You short out motion detectors.

You don't even wait for the water to boil anymore.

Your nervous twitch registers on the Richter scale.

You help your dog chase its tail.

You soak your dentures in coffee overnight.

Your first-aid kit contains two pints of coffee with an I.V. hookup.

You ski uphill.

You get a speeding ticket even when you're parked.

You answer the door before people knock.

You haven't blinked since the last lunar eclipse.

Or at least I've tried.  One of my neighbors was jumping around and spinning around swinging his 14 day old baby around in Penneys and he tripped over a stool.  Sprained his knee in the fall.  Baby was unhurt.  Anyway....
He wore a full brace (you know, the soft cast type) for TWO days, never limped and NEVER used the crutches, around here.  Then he starts bragging to my hubby about how he's "gonna get a buncha money off Penney's and buy two acres of land, trade homes and live easy for awhile".  THAT was just more than I could stand.
I called Penneys, ended up talking to their insurance carrier about how he's the most active "wounded" person I've ever seen.
They WERE gonna just settle, now they're gonna send an investigator out.  Seems this s.o.b. was going to sue for lost wages, loss of affection, pain and suffering and the fear that his child suffered.  I told the claims adjuster, "You have to have a job to have lost wages, don't you?"  LOL  This fucker quit work 7 months ago, been living at home on welfare, not lifting a finger to do anything but put the beer can to his mouth.  
Re. loss of affection-- His wife told me he's been impotent for about 5 months now, at least he's not having sex with her.  Don't you have to actually have HAD a sex life in order to lose it?  
Re. the child's fear-- He was 14 days old.....  How scared could he get?  
Re. pain and suffering-- Now I'm not an attorney...  Can you collect for 5 minutes pain?  
For two days he used the soft cast, for 2 days he used another, smaller brace....  Today he jogged....  Exactly how much pain could he be in????  
The adjuster said he'll keep my name, and the name of another neighbor who's called out of the situation as completely as possible.  To do this he's having a local adjuster come out to investigate/watch, and question neighbors.  Then they're going to sit down with him and his attorney and let him know WHAT they've been told but not by whom.  Things should get very interesting.  LOL
Insurance fraud costs all of us a fortune and I won't sit idly by and watch it happen if I can stop it.

She's not patient!!!!!!!   
HAPPY NOW?????????  





btw, I have NO idea what "exanimate" means, just wanted to see the icon.....

The fat cow bitch who holds the balls in her relationship and her lackey boy who, apparently, doesn't WANT his balls, have managed to piss off the ONE holdout, the ONE person who was trying her very level best to maintain some level of friendship and stay OUT of the bullshit of others.  
I'm not locking this because the cow and her ballless one know what I think and I have a sneaking suspicion my lj is quite the topic of discussion.   
When you manage to piss of someone who is so patient and understanding that she makes God look hateful, I know I'm glad I cut them loose months ago.  
It's a shame too, because the last one is probably the best person either of them will ever have the privilege of knowing.  Oh, well, it's their loss, definitely not hers.
Hell, the ballless one dragged her in when he couldn't get me to bend to the will of his cow.  It really is a shame, getting married and still so childish that they have to drag EVERY mutual acquaintance in to any disagreement.  ~tsk~tsk~tsk~
If Omar's done with the dress yet......

LAW AGAINST SMELLY TOURISTS
    The mayor of the French resort La Grand-Mottehas has instituted a new law against smelly tourists.
    The law allows police officers to stop people leaving the beach in swimwear for an odor check. Anyone found to be too smelly will be ordered to cover up or get a fine, the Web site Ananova reports.
    Mayor Henri Dunoyer says tourists stinking of sweat and suntan lotion put him off his food and wine as they pass the terrace of his favorite restaurant.
    Dunoyer says Britons are among the worst offenders, although it's been reported that the French use less soap than anyone in Europe, Ananova reports.
    "I sit on the terrace of one of my favorite restaurants trying to enjoy good food and wine, and then a smelly tourist comes in and ruins everything," he says.
    As a "goodwill gesture" the mayor has arranged for special T-shirts to be handed out, but some local hoteliers are horrified by the whole thing, fearing it will frighten off paying guests.


(Ok.  Now, my hubby went to French Commando school in France.  He says the FRENCH are smellier than ANY tourists they have!  LOL  Maybe it's the smell of CLEAN bodies that is alien to his nose, and it scares him.)

I'm keeping a neighbor's daughter for the rest of the summer, while the mom is at work.  I hate to call it "babysitting" because the girl is 11 yrs old and really is helpful.  She's keeping the girls entertained and they're all having fun.  She's a nice kid.

Just got in from the concert.  It was AWESOME!!!  Made even better by the fact that it was FREE.  LOL
They did 99% of their stuff and "California Dreamin'", it was great.  We got right out near the front of the top tier of the crowd, and had a great view of the stage.  WOOHOO!!!!!!
We danced and sang and had a blast!
each Boys RULE!!!!!!

The girls played at a neighbor's house all day.  It was quiet here, so I got the cooking bug.  Made some macaroni salad, MAN was it good!  Then did some deviled eggs, my best yet.  LOL
Ended up grilling with the neighbor who'd had the girls over all day, spur of the moment, they had been planning on eating out, but they had a brisket and we had the Mac.salad and some great smoked sausage.  We grilled and ate and drank.  Watched the fireworks in Ashland, from the front yard.  Which was nice, we didn't have to drive down into town to see them.  I LOVE living close to the river!
After the Ashland fireworks, we had our own, and watched those of people all around us.  And we got to listen to most of the concert on the river in Ashland's Summer Motion, started at 10.  We're still going to see the Beach Boys tonight, at 10.  Planning on going down early to check out the carnival they have set up, and catch some of The Fortunes, they're on at 8 pm before the Beach Boys.  Marti's all ready to go.  She loves the Beach Boys, Charlie's just interested in the carnival.  
It should be fun, gotta get film for the camera.... Hope we can take pics at the concert.

Things To Say When You're Stressed at Work 
 
1. Okay, okay! I take it back. Unfuck you!!! 
2. You say I'm a bitch like it's a bad thing?! 
3. How many times do I have to flush before you go away? 
4. Well this day was a total waste of make-up. 
5. Well aren't we a bloody ray of sunshine? 
6. Don't bother me, I'm living happily ever after. 
7. Do I look like a fucking people person! 
8. This isn't an office. It's HELL with fluorescent lighting. 
9. I started out with nothing still have most of it left. 
10. I pretend to work, they pretend to pay me. 
11 YOU!!... off my planet!!! 
12. Therapy is expensive. Popping bubble plastic is cheap. You choose. 
13. Practice random acts of intelligence and senseless acts of self-control. 
14. Errors have been made. Others will be blamed. 
15. And your cry-baby, whiny-assed opinion would be.....? 
16. I'm not crazy. I've been in a very bad mood for 30 years. 
17. Sarcasm is just one more service I offer. 
18. Whatever kind of look you were going for, you missed. 
19. Do they ever shut up on your planet? 
20. I'm not your type. I'm not inflatable. 
21. Stress is when you wake up screaming and you realize you haven't gone to sleep yet. 
22. Back off!! You're standing in my aura. 
23. Don't worry. I forgot your name too. 
24. I just want revenge. Is that so wrong? 
25. I work 45 hours a week to be this poor. 
26. Nice perfume. Must you marinate in it. 
27. Not all men are annoying. Some are dead. 
28. Wait...I'm trying to imagine you with a personality. 
29. Chaos, panic and disorder . . . my work here is done. 
30. Ambivalent? Well yes and no. 
31. You look like shit. Is that the style now? 
32. Earth is full. Go home. 
33. Aw, did I step on your poor little bitty ego? 
34. I'm not tense, just terribly, terribly alert. 
35. A hard-on doesn't count as personal growth. 
36. You are depriving some village of an idiot. 
37. If ass holes could fly, this place would be an airport.

To the lake again yesterday.  It was great.  There were 4 lifeguards and 5 swimmers, LOL, three of those were kids.  The other mother and I sat on the beach chatting with the guards, all cute boys and very nice.  They also played with the kids.  I'm planning on calling the lake management and complimenting these kids.

Supreme Court Upholds School Voucher Program 
Thu Jun 27,12:40 PM ET 
By James Vicini 

WASHINGTON (Reuters) - A bitterly divided U.S. Supreme Court  ruled on Thursday that poor students can use public money to attend religious schools, a victory for President Bush  and other tuition voucher advocates. 
  
On the last day of its term, the high court ruled by a 5-4 vote that a private school voucher program in Cleveland that pays up to $2,250 per year to qualified students does not violate constitutional church-state separation. 

In one of the most important church-state cases in decades on an issue that could reshape American education, the high court's opinion by Chief Justice William Rehnquist said the program passed constitutional muster because it was "neutral" and did not advance religion. 

The dissenters, the court's four most liberal members, denounced the decision as a dramatic departure from past rulings and warned public funds will pay for religious indoctrination of thousands of elementary school children. 

They said the ruling created the risk of religious-based strife harmful to the nation's social fabric and removed another brick from the wall of separation between church and state. 

The decision added to a string of rulings by the court's conservative majority in recent years that have lowered the wall of separation between church and state by allowing some state involvement with religious schools. 

In the term that begins in October, the justices may confront another important school church-state case -- a ruling on Wednesday by a U.S. appeals court in California that the "Pledge of Allegiance" was unconstitutional because of the phrase one nation "under God." 

RULING BOOSTS SCHOOL VOUCHER MOVEMENT 

The voucher ruling, with sweeping national consequences for education policy, cleared the way for other cities and states to adopt similar programs. There now are publicly funded school voucher programs only in Cleveland, Milwaukee and Florida. 

Voucher opponents blasted the ruling. 

"The Supreme Court has taken a wrecking ball to the wall of separation between church and state," the Rev. Barry Lynn of the group Americans United for Separation of Church and State said. He called it the worst decision in 50 years. 

Rehnquist said the Ohio program was adopted for the valid secular purpose of providing educational assistance to poor children in a failing public school system. 

"It provides benefits directly to a wide spectrum of individuals, defined only by financial need and residence in a particular school district," he said. 

"It permits such individuals to exercise genuine choice among options public and private, secular and religious. The program is therefore a program of true private choice," Rehnquist said in the 21-page ruling. 

He said Cleveland school children have a range of options. 

"They may remain in public school as before, remain in public school with publicly funded tutoring aid, obtain a scholarship and choose a religious school, obtain a scholarship and choose a nonreligious private school, enroll in a community school or enroll in a magnet school," he said. 

Justice Clarence Thomas, the court's only black member, wrote a separate concurring opinion, saying, "Today, many of our inner-city schools deny emancipation to urban minority children." 

He praised publicly funded private school choice programs as a way to raise the quality of education for underprivileged urban children. 

Justices John Paul Stevens, David Souter, Ruth Bader Ginsburg and Stephen Breyer dissented. 

"Whenever we remove a brick from the wall that was designed to separate religion and government, we increase the risk of religious strife and weaken the foundation of our democracy," Stevens said. 

Souter agreed in a dissent that he read from the bench. 

"Public tax money will pay ... for teaching the covenant with Israel and Mosaic law in Jewish schools, the primacy of the Apostle Peter and the Papacy in Catholic schools, the truth of reformed Christianity in Protestant schools and the revelation to the Prophet in Muslim schools," he said. 

Breyer said the majority effectively "turns the clock back" to a view the high court rejected more than half a century ago. 

"In a society composed of many different religious creeds, I fear that this present departure ... risks creating a form of religiously based conflict potentially harmful to the nation's social fabric," he said.

Tell the Senate to STOP Bush's Anti-Choice Judges 
A raft of anti-choice judges who lack respect for women's rights may 
be confirmed by the Senate unless you act TODAY.  Please contact your 
Senators and tell them to STOP the confirmation of anti-woman, anti-
choice judges.

President Bush has nominated over 100 conservatives to the federal 
judiciary - 57 of whom have already been confirmed by the Senate.  
These judges have demonstrated records of hostility to women's 
equality and reproductive freedom and are poised to further roll back 
a woman's right to choose. These actions are a concerted effort to 
control the judicial branch of the government.

Please contact your Senators TODAY and tell them to reject anti-
choice, anti-woman judicial nominees.  Click here 
http://www.naralaction.org/index.asp?step=2&item=1659to send an 
email to your Senators. **Please forward this email to your pro-
choice friends and ask them to take action on this critical issue.**

Here are just a few of Bush's egregious judicial nominees who may 
come up for a Senate vote this summer. Click here for more 
information, http://www.naral.org/mediaresources/fact_sheet.html#10

D. Brooks Smith:  Nominated to the Third Circuit Court of Appeals. 
For many years, Smith belonged to a club that refuses to admit women, 
a violation of judicial ethics. In 1988 he promised the Judiciary 
Committee that he would resign from this club.  Yet he failed to 
resign until ten years later, when the chance to move to the higher 
court opened up.  

Lavenski Smith:  Nominated to the Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals, 
Lavenski Smith is extremely anti-choice.  He represented the "Unborn 
Child Amendment Committee" in its unsuccessful lawsuit to prevent 
abortions from being performed at a state hospital in Arkansas, even 
when the state was not paying for the abortion.  

John Rogers:  Nominated to the Sixth Circuit Court of Appeals, Rogers 
has advocated overturning Roe v. Wade.  As a Justice Department 
lawyer in the Reagan administration, Rogers wrote a brief urging the 
Supreme Court to overturn Roe as "arbitrary" and "inherently 
unworkable." 

Dennis Shedd:  Nominated to the Fourth Circuit Court of Appeals, 
Shedd was a top aide to Senator Strom Thurmond, a potent anti-choice 
leader in the U.S. Senate, for many years.  As a district court 
judge, Shedd has demonstrated great hostility to civil rights and a 
lack of respect for the right to privacy.  

Priscilla Owen:  Nominated to the Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals, 
Owen is a far right fringe justice on the already conservative 
Supreme Court of Texas. As a justice, she has repeatedly tried to 
deny young women access to abortion and has even suggested that young 
women be required to receive religious counseling before obtaining an 
abortion. In trying to deny young women access to abortion, Owen has 
so blatantly ignored the law that even President Bush's own White 
House counsel thinks Owen's view is an "unconscionable act of 
judicial activism." 

Your Senators must hear that you care about the constitutional right 
to privacy and to choice, and that you are watching their votes on 
Bush's right-wing judicial nominations.  In addition to sending an 
e-mail at http://www.naralaction.org/index.asp?step=2&item=1659, 
please call your Senators and tell them that you oppose these five 
judges - especially Owen - as well as Bush's other anti-choice, anti-
woman nominees.  

Call the Senate switchboard at 202-224-3121 and ask for your 
Senator's office.  Also, please call Senate Majority Leader Tom 
Daschle at 202-224-2321 and ask him not to make deals on judges that 
will threaten a woman's right to choose.  And if you can, write a 
personal letter and send it in the mail to both of your Senators at 
United States Senate, Washington, D.C. 20850.

* * * * * * * * * * *
For more information about national NARAL or your state 
affiliate, log on to http://www.naral.org. 

Please forward this message to pro-choice friends and 
family members. NARAL's Choice Action Network (CAN) 
provides up-to-date information and easy ways to make a 
difference in protecting a woman's right to choose.  If 
this message was forwarded to you, subscribe to the Choice 
Action Network at http://www.naralaction.org/joinForm.asp 
or send an e-mail with your name and address to 
can@naral.orgwith the text "subscribe CAN."

Why do people expect more than they're willing to give?  Previously I mentioned the pig child of a neighbor who came over and wanted to play in our pool, without my kids.  Well, she is the child of "fundies"... They make sure she's on the church bus EVERY time it comes thru, she goes to two or three different churches, simply because her parents want her out.  Wellll... The girl comes over yesterday and tells Marti, "My momma got me a pool.  But noone else can play in it."  This kid is old enough to know better.  I told her, "Remember all the times you've eaten dinner here, spent the night because there was noone else in your house and you were afraid to be alone, ridden to the library with us because your mom didn't want to take you.  When your mother is ready to say Thank you, come back.  Until then, like I told you the other day when you wanted to play in OUR pool ALONE, do not come back over here."
I'm not asking much, as a matter of fact, until the last few days I didn't even ask a "Thank you" from the fat bitch.  But then her kid hurts my kids feelings....  That is just beyond forgiveable and Now, I'm PISSED.  As much time as the kid spends in church you'd think she'd learn SOMETHING about being christian.
I saw the mother later and told her that she didn't have ANY trouble with "sharing" when I was the one giving to HER kid.  And that until SHE learned the value of GIVE as well as take, I didn't want her, her kids, or anyone or anything from their household coming to my home.  (The anything was because every fucking time we turn around the Lab puppy they have is running away from them and coming to my yard to shit.  Heehee... I took care of that though.  Positively EVIL plan came to me, heehee)
Why do people do things that they KNOW are stupid?  THEN whine and expect sympathy?  If you're sick, you don't do things that will irritate your illness.  Unless, of course, you're a weak willed IDIOT.  If you know you have to drive, DON'T drink, if you do, don't complain when you get busted.  Rent/Mortgage payments, insurance, utilities, groceries, ALL expenses that occur on a regular basis, NOT unexpected expenses, if you piss your money away, don't poor mouth, because you deserve no sympathy.  You were stupid.

for hunting dumb-asses.  LOL  My neighbor, against my advice, ordered a Gateway computer.  I told her, I'd help her set it up if she wanted to order from someone like Dell.  "Oh no, Gateway sends you the chart.  We (her and her hubby) won't need any help setting it up."
THAT was a joke!  She could have gotten the SAME system from Dell for about 300 less, or my brother could have put the system together for her for about $500 less.  But NNNOOOOOO.  Anyhooo... she gets the machine today, and they don't know where to START.  So, guess who gets begged to help.

THEN, they can't register anything because it's all set up for internet registration and they don't have a phone line, much less internet service.  So, we start discussing the dial up vs cable modem.  Ok, here's the conversation:
Him: Guess I'll have to get a phone line.
Me:  You can get a cable modem for 40 a month from our cable    
company.
Him:  That's an awful lot of money.
Me:   Look at it this way...  Fone is $27 a month just to have it in the house.  THEN you have $22 a month for an internet service.....  How is that cheaper than $40?
Him:  I don't know.
Me:   You don't have a fone cuz you ran up a $300 bill, right?
Him:  Yeah
Me:   Well, you think the fone company's gonna give you a fone without getting paid that outstanding bill?
Him:  Ok, so what do I need to tell the cable company when I call?

LOL  Some people just can't see the forest for the trees.

To the lake again today.  They had a ball.  Hubby plays in the water with them, and is slowly convincing Marti that she CAN swim.  We all had a good time, it was nice, not too crowded until we were getting ready to leave.  We got there just as the beach opened so it was empty, just us and about 8 other people.
I'm suffering now.  Been trying to catch a cold all week.  got up with a sore throat today, hubby tried to cancel the lake trip, but I just didn't have the heart to disappoint the girls.  NOW, I wish I'd just sent them all and stayed home.  I have a seriously sore throat.  
Marti likes the floats and will go as far as we'll let her in the lake.  Charlie, on the other hand, likes the floats, but doesn't want to get her face wet, so she stays in ankle to hip deep water and plays in the sand.  
Got home and found that the retard dachsund had pissed in the kitchen, not once but 7 times.  LOL  I don't know where he gets it, but that is the one pissingest dog I've ever seen.  So, I had to mop the kitchen as soon as I walked in.  He was hiding behind the couch.  We didn't punish him, we were gone 6 hours and he's used to going out every 2-3 hours, AND he didn't piss on the carpet, just the tile floor.  But, he's my baby boy and, big doofus that he is, I love him, he's a part of the family.

Oh, yeah!  What does everyone think about the sudden death of Darryl Kile?  Apparently he died in his sleep, natural causes, 33 yrs old.  Five yr old twins and 10 month old and a wife.  Such a shame.

The girls conned me into setting up the tent in the back yard.  THAT was an adventure in itself....   Well, they wanted to sleep in it (OF COURSE).  So, Night before last we slept in the tent.  Both dogs and the cat just HAD to be there too.
Well, the cat got kicked out because she kept pouncing on anything that moved in the sleeping bags.  
THEN, the dogs decide they want to go inside, at 4:30 a.m.!
I tried to calm them down and make them go back to sleep but they weren't having it.  So, put them in the house.  Went back to the tent to TRY to get some sleep.  Well, 6:30, out come the dogs, bouncing into the tent, hubby let them out when he got up.
I finally gave up.  I was so sore, felt like I'd been beat up.  LOL  Needless to say, I took the tent down within an hour of the girls coming inside for breakfast.  
Went to be early early early last night.  LOL  I bet I didn't sleep 2 hours all night outside.  
The things we do for our kids!!
You'd think people would have better things to do.  LOL  I know I do.  But it IS nice to know that I am SSSOOO interesting that there are those who are positively ADDICTED to me.

Skakel Found Guilty in 27-Year-Old Conn. Murder 
Fri Jun 7,12:20 PM ET 

NORWALK (Reuters) - Kennedy family relative Michael Skakel was convicted on Friday of the 1975 murder of his next door neighbor, laying to rest a quarter-century-old mystery of who bludgeoned Martha Moxley to death on the lawn of her family's home. 

Skakel, 41, a nephew of Ethel Kennedy, the widow of the late Sen. Robert F. Kennedy, is facing a life sentence in the murder of Moxley on Oct. 30, 1975, in the affluent Connecticut town of Greenwich. 

A solemn jury delivered the verdict without looking at Skakel shortly after beginning their fourth day of deliberations following a four-week trial. 

A loud cry went up from one of Moxley's friends as the verdict was read. Moxley's brother, John, and her mother, Dorthy, hugged when the verdict was read. 

Skakel appeared to bend a knee and pray next to the defense table a few minutes before the jury's decision. After the verdict, his hands shook as he moved to his chair and his attorney Mickey Sherman offered him words of consolation. 

Moxley was found on the lawn of her parents' home beaten to death with a golf club that investigators matched to a set owned by Skakel's mother. 

Authorities said she had been killed the night before. 

The evidence against Skakel was largely circumstantial. At the start of the investigation, authorities focused on Thomas Skakel, Michael's older brother and the last person to admit to seeing Moxley alive. 

But the investigation stalled for two decades until authorities found discrepancies between Michael Skakel's original statements to police and those he made to private investigators hired by his father in 1992 to clear his name. 

In 1975, Skakel told police that he and two of his brothers went out in the family car, returned home after 11 p.m. and went straight to bed. After state investigators brought in forensic expert Dr. Henry Lee to reconstruct the case in 1991, Skakel modified his alibi. 

He said he had not been able to fall asleep, became sexually aroused and climbed the pine tree under which the body was later found and masturbated before returning home. 

Skakel said he did not originally tell anyone about the masturbation for fear they might think he was the killer. 

Lee never found any incriminating DNA at the scene. 

But prosecutors said Skakel had made confessions and incriminating statements, some of them to classmates at the Elan School for troubled adolescents in Maine, which specializes in treating alcohol and drug abuse. 

Prosecutor Jonathan Benedict said Elan classmate Gregory Coleman portrayed Skakel as a "spoiled brat who boasted of the killing and said he could get away with anything." 

Coleman told the grand jury Skakel had confessed to the crime in 1978, but he later said he had been high on heroin when he testified. Coleman died last year of a drug overdose.

I actually agree with Rush Limbaugh on this!
 
What's a Military Family Worth? 
  by Rush Limbaugh 
  March 11, 2002 
  
I think the vast differences in compensation between the victims of the 
September 11th casualty, and those who die serving the country in uniform, 
are profound. No one is really talking about it either because you just 
don't criticize anything having to do with September 11th. Well, I just 
can't let the numbers pass by because it says something really disturbing 
about the entitlement mentality of this country. If you lost a family member in the September 11th attack, you're going to 
get an average of $1,185,000. The range is a minimum guarantee of $250,000,all the way up to $4.7 million. If you are a surviving family member of an American soldier killed in action, 
the first check you get is a $6,000 direct death benefit, half of which is taxable. 
Next, you get $1,750 for burial costs. If you are the surviving spouse, you get 
$833 a month until you remarry. And there's a payment of $211 per month for 
each child under 18. When the child hits 18, those payments come to a screeching halt. Keep in mind that some of the people that are getting an average of $1.185 
million up to $4.7 million are complaining that it's not enough. We also learned over the weekend that some of the victims from the Oklahoma 
City bombing have started an organization asking for the same deal that the 
September 11th families are getting. In addition to that, some of the 
families of those bombed in the embassies are now asking for compensation as 
well. You see where this is going, don't you? Folks, this is part and parcel of over fifty years of entitlement politics 
in this country. It's just really sad. "Patriotism is not a short and frenzied outburst of emotion but the tranquil 
and steady dedication of a lifetime." --Adlai E. Stevenson, Jr. Every time when a pay raise comes up for the military they usually receive 
next to nothing of a raise. Now the green machine is in combat in the MiddleEast while their families have to survive on food stamps and live in low 
rent housing. However our own U.S. Congress just voted themselves a raise, 
and many of you don't know that they only have to be in Congress one-time to 
receive a pension that is more than $15,000 per month and most are now equal 
to be millionaires plus. They also do not receive Social Security on 
retirement because they didn't have to pay into the system. If some of the military people stay in for 20 years and get out as an E-7 
you may receive a pension of $1,000 per month, and the very people who 
placed you in harms way receive a pension of $15,000 per month. I would like 
to see our elected officials pick up a weapon and join ranks before they 
start cutting out benefits and lowering pay for our sons and daughters who 
are now fighting. 
Rush Limbaugh 
March 11, 2002

(I'd also like to add that for every dollar that the US military receives in a raise they lose at least the equivalent and usually $3 in benefits.  They got a raise and LOST free dental coverage for dependents, and gained the privilege of paying for the insurance.  I could go on for hours about this.)

SNAKE CHARMER HAS NO FRIENDS
    A girl in northern India claims she can detect the presence of snakes by their smell, reports the newspaper Navyug.
    The 4-year-old has astonished people by pulling cobras and pythons out of holes near the Shiva temple in Ranchi and then the snakes wrap themselves around Dipti Agarwal's neck.
    The snakes are my best friends and want me to play with them and I know they are around from their smell, the girl says. 
    "It's simply amazing how snakes are attracted towards her and she to them -- there appears to be a divine bond," says priest Jatashankar Maharaj.
    The girl's businessman father says he is worried for her future and dreads the possibility of her being bitten by a poisonous snake, Navyug reports.
    "She has been attracted towards snakes since she was 1, but the amazing thing is that she has not been bitten even once -- each time she picks up a cobra I feel I am going to have a heart attack and I keep praying that it will not bite her," her father says. 
    The father adds that he wished his daughter would forget about snakes and show some interest in playing with children her own age, but she doesn't have a single friend because other children are scared of her.


(Arcamax, "The Human Factor)
